children.subject:
first time TAs need to take a pedagogy class, which either 370 or 375 will satisfy

375 is only open to first time ta's, and as part of 370 there is a requirement for doing 1-on-1 tutoring

So is 370 a requirement for TA'ing in the future? If I haven't applied to TA anywhere for next semester yet should I still take this? And what's the difference between 370 and 375 besides time commitment?
No due date; rolling admission until all spots are filled.
By when do we hear back on our application?
When are we able to enroll in CS375?

history.content:
Enrollment applications are open for Spring 2020 CS370: Adaptive Teaching Methods in Computer Science!
CS370 Application: https://tinyurl.com/us32fau


The two lectures to choose from are as follows:
Monday 1:00pm-3:00pm in 310 Jacobs or
Tuesdays 11:00am-1:00pm in 310 Jacobs


Applications are open for enrolling in CS370 for the Spring 2020 semester! The delay in enrollment was due to getting the best room for the course which is 310 Jacobs Hall; we have successfully reserved this room so both offered lectures will be there. I’m hopeful that we will—for the first time—be able to meet all demand. We will be completing our first review of applications this Friday December 13, and once you're accepted we will manually add you to the course with no further action necessary on your part. After Friday, I will be enrolling students in the course every few days until the course is full or all demand is met.


What is CS370?
CS370 is our course on adaptive teaching in CS which meets the mandatory course requirement for first-time TAs--though it can be taken as early as the semester following your completion of one of the following: Data8, CS10, CS61A, or EE16A. The course is a 3-unit graduate course on teaching that is available for a letter-grade or P/NP basis.



This course is highly interactive with everyone participating in designing materials and resources to help you as a tutor, mentor, and TA—also, most of the material translates effectively to industry and academia. CS370 emphasizes adapting your teaching techniques based on student learning styles and academic performance. It's also equity-oriented which means you learn how to applydifferent instructional methods and assessments to optimize learning for multiple student backgrounds and their preferred learning strategies.

Unlike CS375/EE375 this course is 3 units and does require tutoring each week (1-3 hours per week depending on your potential course staff roles; most non-TAs complete 3 hours per week). The difference in time commitment between 375 and 370 is about an hour per week, and the majority of students find it to be worthwhile, though the choice is entirely yours.
If interested in a more detailed description, please read it on the application website:
https://tinyurl.com/us32fau
 

Thank you and spread the word to those who might be interested!
-Christopher-

PS Email me at cthunn@berkeley.edu with questions; just put CS370 in the subject line. Thanks again!
history.subject: CS370: Adaptive Teaching Methods in CS is now open for enrollment (link for enrollment in post)!
